author: Special Correspondent
text:
Smitha Pansare, daughter of rationalist CPI leader Govind Pansare, who was shot dead by two youths last year in Maharashtra, on Sunday called out to writers and intellectuals to write against fundamentalism.

Addressing a seminar on intolerance organised by All India Progressive Front and Doctors’ Association for Social Equality to coincide with Valentine’s Day here, she said it is the responsibility of intellectuals to lead the common man towards a new society.

Asking intellectuals to come together to fight against injustice, she said, “The time has come for everyone to join hands with unity and responsibility and after the death of University of Hyderabad Dalit research scholar Rohith Vemula, one should not be silent, as that would become a crime.”

CPI leader D. Pandian said an attempt was being made by the Modi government to interfere in the free functioning of universities.

It took 15 years to rebuild Nalanda University, but almost overnight Hindutva forces were trying to gain control and plant seeds of intolerance there, he said.
title: Intellectuals urged to lead fight against fundamentalism
